isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 9000 Pro Sleeper After 05/01/1997, and 9800 Model After 07/01/1997 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - EVAPORATOR

warning.para: Before performing any of the following procedures, read the SERVICE WARNINGS. Failure to read the service warnings and to be aware of the dangers involved when working with refrigerant could lead to serious personal injury.

step1.para: Make sure the key switch and the A/C switch are in the OFF position.
Recover the refrigerant from the air conditioning system. Refer to S16019, AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the Master Service Manual.
Under the cab, remove the expansion valve. Refer to EXPANSION VALVE, Remove .
From inside the cab, remove the passenger seat and Blend-Air unit cover. Refer to BLEND-AIR UNIT COVER, Remove .

caution.para: In the following step, handle the capillary tube with care while removing it from the end of the evaporator. If the tube is kinked or damaged, the thermostatic switch will require replacing.

step1.para: Remove the thermostatic switch capillary tube from the end of the evaporator. Refer to THERMOSTATIC SWITCH, Remove . NOTE: It is not necessary to remove the switch from the Blend-Air unit during this procedure.
Remove the two clips that secure the evaporator in the blend-air unit ( Figure 35) and pull the evaporator up out of the unit ( Figure 36).
Install the evaporator in the Blend-Air unit ( Figure 36).
Install the two clips that secure the evaporator in the blend-air unit ( Figure 35).

caution.para: In the following step, handle the capillary tube with care while installing it into the end of the evaporator. If the tube is kinked or damaged, the thermostatic switch will require replacing.

step1.para: Install the thermostatic switch capillary tube in the end of the evaporator. Refer to THERMOSTATIC SWITCH, Install .
Under the cab, install the expansion valve. Refer to EXPANSION VALVE, Install .
Evacuate and charge the air conditioning system. Refer to S16019, AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the Master Service Manual.

note.para: In the following step, to verify correct A/C operation at the air duct outlets, the cover must be in place on the Blend-Air unit.

step1.para: Start engine and check the air conditioning system for leaks and proper operation.
Install Blend-Air unit cover and passenger seat. Refer to BLEND-AIR UNIT COVER, Install .
